pullRequest.body:
I noticed when debugging #18734 that `Topology/Sheaves/Stalks.lean` imports ordered rings / groups / monoids, but those are not at all used. This will be fixed if we split off the import of `CommRingCat` in the sheaf constructions into their own files.

This moves all declarations in `Topology/Sheaves` involving `CommRingCat` into a new file `Sheaves/CommRingCat.lean`, except those of `Sheaves/Operations.lean` since that file is already entirely about sheaves of rings.

(I am not at all comfortable in this area of the library, so I expect the file name and docs are highly suboptimal. I welcome all corrections to my ignorance :D)


---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

| `Mathlib.Topology.Sheaves.CommRingCat`|1451|

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
We should also put some `assert_not_exists`s in to avoid `OrderedMonoid`.

I could find directly importing `CommRingCat` (i.e. `Mathlib.Algebra.Category.Ring.Basic` or its immediate descendants):
 * `Mathlib.Topology.Sheaves.Forget`
 * `Mathlib.Topology.Sheaves.PresheafOfFunctions`
 * `Mathlib.Topology.Sheaves.Stalks`
 * `Mathlib.Topology.Sheaves.SheafCondition.ObjSup`
and transitively:
 * `Mathlib.Topology.Sheaves.SheafCondition.UniqueGluing`
 * `Mathlib.Topology.Sheaves.SheafOfFunctions`
 * `Mathlib.Topology.Sheaves.Operations`
 * `Mathlib.Topology.Sheaves.Skyscraper`
 * `Mathlib.Topology.Sheaves.LocalPredicate`
 * `Mathlib.Topology.Sheaves.SheafCondition.ObjSup`
 * `Mathlib.Topology.Sheaves.Sheafify`

My mental picture is import things from `Topology.Sheaves.CommRingCat` if you want sheaves valued in commutative rings. Otherwise, don't. Hopefully, we don't have to go through `CommRingCat` to get sheaves of abelian groups.

> My mental picture is import things from `Topology.Sheaves.CommRingCat` if you want sheaves valued in commutative rings. Otherwise, don't. Hopefully, we don't have to go through `CommRingCat` to get sheaves of abelian groups.

Ok! I'll try and do the change but I can't say for sure that I have the knowledge to do this cleanly.
Done! I haven't written anything in the module doc for the new `CommRingCat` file, could you please take care of that @mattrobball?
I merged `Topology.Sheaves.Operations` into `Topology.Sheaves.CommRingCat` also and `section`ed off with names corresponding to the source files.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11763981722/job/32768605592)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11763981722/job/32768605691)

LGTM
Thanks for doing this!

Thanks!
bors r+
What other files in `Topology.Sheaves` import `CommRingCat`? Can we just call the new file `CommRingCat` and dump more things here?
Thank you for the changes and fixes :D

LGTM
Thanks for doing this!

Thanks!
bors r+

```suggestion
Authors: Kim Morrison, Andrew Yang
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Topology/Sheaves): split off results on sheaves of rings
